answers.answer: Hi and welcome. if you have had a continuous discharge since last april you should see your doctor about this. Could be yeast or BV. Very common when the pH in your vagina gets off balanced.
I did see her and asked her about it, she said that it could be all the anibitocs..yeast but wouldnt she have given me a perscription?

If she said it was yeast, then yes. The goal of treating yeast is to reduce the overgrowth of yeast organisms. Over the counter treatments for yeast are available. Why dont you call her monday and ask her this question because it is a good question!
Okay i will. And lastly can sex through off my ph balance causing me to have this discharge?
The most common would be:Increased stressUse of oral contraceptivesDiabetesPregnancyUse of antibiotics (protective bacteria are destroyed by antibiotics, allowing yeast overgrowth)

question: So in april i was diagnosed with chlamydia got treatment for it.2 weeks ago i went to the doctors to get retested they told me it came back negative.I also came back negative for trich and gonorrhea.My question is why do i still have the yellowish color discharge, is it a yeast infection/bacterial infection? thanks.additional info. Before i had sex i was on azithro powder, and doxy for 7 days...didnt have sex. but up to a couple weeks ago i had protected sex with my new partner and the condom didnt break. but we did engage in foreplay before hand.
title: yellowish discharge.
